decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo of Cephalid Illusionist, Nomads en-Kor, and other key pieces to mill your library and win the game with Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return. It utilizes Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Nadu, Winged Wisdom for card advantage and protection, while also running disruption in the form of Force of Will and Daze. Urza's Saga provides additional value by tutoring for key artifacts like Shuko. The deck also includes a mix of cantrips and removal to help dig for combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main idea behind this deck is to use the combo involving Nomads en-Kor, Cephalid Illusionist, and Narcomoeba to quickly mill through the deck, putting cards such as Thassa's Oracle or madness cards into the graveyard. This allows for a quick win condition by either decking out the opponent or setting up a Thassa's Oracle win. The deck also includes various control elements such as Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Urza's Saga helps to tutor for key combo pieces.

The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Spirit of the Labyrinth to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also utilizing disruptive spells like Swords to Plowshares to control the board. The deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent while also using cards like Mother of Runes and Giver of Runes to protect its own creatures. Additionally, the deck has a strong equipment package with cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Batterskull to provide additional threats and value. The deck also has a solid mana denial package with cards like Rishadan Port and Wasteland.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays and disrupting the opponent's strategy while maintaining tempo. By using a combination of powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares alongside disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Daze, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and apply pressure on the opponent. Additionally, cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Dauthi Voidwalker provide card advantage and further disruption, making it challenging for the opponent to stabilize and make a comeback.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Magus of the Moon and Blood Moon, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Pyrogoyf and Broadside Bombardiers. The deck utilizes fast mana acceleration with cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Chrome Mox to power out threats quickly. Chalice of the Void is used to further disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also has a toolbox of powerful artifacts to tutor for with Urza's Saga. Overall, the strategy revolves around punishing opponents with land hate and efficient threats.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly assemble a board state with small, evasive creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent while protecting them with countermagic like Force of Will and Daze. Once your opponent is unprepared, you can pump up your creatures with cards like Berserk and Invigorate to deal lethal poison damage in one swing. The deck also includes tools like Brainstorm and Ponder to find key pieces while maintaining card advantage. Additionally, Inkmoth Nexus provides an alternative win condition by turning into a creature and infecting the opponent.

The deck focuses on assembling a combo with Nadu, Winged Wisdom as the centerpiece, using Nomads en-Kor and Shaman en-Kor to draw cards and generate mana. It includes cards that help protect the combo pieces like Sylvan Safekeeper and Collector Ouphe, while also providing mana acceleration with cards like Gaea's Cradle and Noble Hierarch. The deck has a toolbox approach with cards like Chord of Calling and Green Sun's Zenith to search for key pieces, while also having some disruptive elements like Endurance and Allosaurus Shepherd to interact with the opponent.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently dump your entire library into your graveyard, utilizing cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer. Then, you use Thassa's Oracle to win the game by having no cards left in your library. The deck also includes cards like Poxwalkers, Boggart Trawler, and Disciple of Freyalise to help facilitate this strategy, along with disruption in the form of Pact of Negation, Cabal Therapy, and Thoughtseize to protect your combo. Additionally, there are some reanimation spells like Reanimate and Dread Return for added versatility.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing counterspells like Force of Will and Stifle, as well as removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan while deploying threats like Phyrexian Dreadnought and Doorkeeper Thrull. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and the ability to manipulate the top of the deck. The inclusion of cards like Triumph of Saint Katherine and Curie, Emergent Intelligence help to further control the game and secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to heavily disrupt the opponent's strategies by using control elements such as Stifle, Force of Will, and Torpor Orb. The deck aims to make the most out of Phyrexian Dreadnought's powerful ability by effectively reducing its drawbacks. By combining efficient card draw with disruptive spells, the deck aims to outmaneuver the opponent and seize control of the game. The inclusion of Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides additional card advantage and disruption options, while Brazen Borrower offers a versatile answer to troublesome threats.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate. It then aims to bring these creatures back into play for a low cost, bypassing their high mana costs. The deck includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent to provide additional threats and pressure the opponent. The strategy revolves around efficiently reanimating creatures and overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, and then bringing them back onto the battlefield with spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The goal is to cheat out high-impact creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly. The deck also includes disruption like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo. With a mix of efficient removal and reanimation spells, this deck aims to consistently execute its game plan and outmaneuver the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Brazen Borrower, then using Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back onto the battlefield for a powerful swing. The deck also includes disruption like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo, as well as controlling elements like Murktide Regent and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The mana base is streamlined to support the combo and includes Wasteland for disruption.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively control the battlefield with efficient creatures like Murktide Regent and Dragon's Rage Channeler while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will and Daze. By combining powerful threats with disruptive spells, the deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain tempo throughout the game. The inclusion of cards like Mishra's Bauble and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student allows for card advantage and selection, enhancing the deck's overall versatility and effectiveness in a variety of matchups.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the game using cheap spells, disruption, and efficient creatures, while utilizing card advantage and tempo plays to outpace the opponent. The deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent with cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent, while also using countermagic like Force of Will and Daze to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes card filtering and selection with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to find key cards and maintain consistency in the deck.
